REPEL.name: Repel
REPEL.description: An item that prevents weak wild Pokémon from appearing for 100 steps after its use.

SUPERREPEL.name: Super Repel
SUPERREPEL.description: An item that prevents weak wild Pokémon from appearing for 200 steps after its use.

MAXREPEL.name: Max Repel
MAXREPEL.description: An item that prevents weak wild Pokémon from appearing for 250 steps after its use.

BLACKFLUTE.name: Black Flute
BLACKFLUTE.description: A black flute made from blown glass. Its melody makes wild Pokémon less likely to appear.

WHITEFLUTE.name: White Flute
WHITEFLUTE.description: A white flute made from blown glass. Its melody makes wild Pokémon more likely to appear.

HONEY.name: Honey
HONEY.description: A sweet honey with a lush aroma that attracts wild Pokémon when used in tall grass, in caves, or elsewhere.

REDSHARD.name: Red Shard
REDSHARD.description: A small red shard. It appears to be from some sort of implement made long ago.

YELLOWSHARD.name: Yellow Shard
YELLOWSHARD.description: A small yellow shard. It appears to be from some sort of implement made long ago.

BLUESHARD.name: Blue Shard
BLUESHARD.description: A small blue shard. It appears to be from some sort of implement made long ago.

GREENSHARD.name: Green Shard
GREENSHARD.description: A small green shard. It appears to be from some sort of implement made long ago.

ENIGMASTONE.name: Enigma Stone
ENIGMASTONE.description: A peculiar stone that makes certain special and stronger species of Pokémon evolve.

FIRESTONE.name: Fire Stone
FIRESTONE.description: A peculiar stone that makes certain species of Pokémon evolve. It is colored orange.

THUNDERSTONE.name: Thunder Stone
THUNDERSTONE.description: A peculiar stone that makes certain species of Pokémon evolve. It has a thunderbolt pattern.

WATERSTONE.name: Water Stone
WATERSTONE.description: A peculiar stone that makes certain species of Pokémon evolve. It is a clear, light blue.

LEAFSTONE.name: Leaf Stone
LEAFSTONE.description: A peculiar stone that makes certain species of Pokémon evolve. It has a leaf pattern.

MOONSTONE.name: Moon Stone
MOONSTONE.description: A peculiar stone that makes certain species of Pokémon evolve. It is as black as the night sky.

SUNSTONE.name: Sun Stone
SUNSTONE.description: A peculiar stone that makes certain species of Pokémon evolve. It is as red as the sun.

DUSKSTONE.name: Dusk Stone
DUSKSTONE.description: A peculiar stone that makes certain species of Pokémon evolve. It is as dark as dark can be.

DAWNSTONE.name: Dawn Stone
DAWNSTONE.description: A peculiar stone that makes certain species of Pokémon evolve. It sparkles like eyes.

SHINYSTONE.name: Shiny Stone
SHINYSTONE.description: A peculiar stone that makes certain species of Pokémon evolve. It shines with a dazzling light.

ICESTONE.name: Ice Stone
ICESTONE.description: A peculiar stone that makes certain species of Pokémon evolve. It has a snowflake pattern.

SWEETAPPLE.name: Sweet Apple
SWEETAPPLE.description: A peculiar apple that can make a certain species of Pokémon evolve. It's exceptionally sweet.

TARTAPPLE.name: Tart Apple
TARTAPPLE.description: A peculiar apple that can make a certain species of Pokémon evolve. It's exceptionally tart.

SYRUPYAPPLE.name: Syrupy Apple
SYRUPYAPPLE.description: A peculiar apple that can make a certain species of Pokémon evolve. It's exceptionally syrupy.

CRACKEDPOT.name: Cracked Pot
CRACKEDPOT.description: A peculiar cracked teapot that can make a certain species of Pokémon evolve. It makes delicious tea.

CHIPPEDPOT.name: Chipped Pot
CHIPPEDPOT.description: A peculiar chipped teapot that can make a certain species of Pokémon evolve. It makes delicious tea.

GALARICACUFF.name: Galarica Cuff
GALARICACUFF.description: A cuff made from woven-together Galarica Twigs. Giving it to a Galarian Slowpoke would make it very happy.

GALARICAWREATH.name: Galarica Wreath
GALARICAWREATH.description: A wreath made from woven-together Galarica Twigs. A Galarian Slowpoke wearing this would be very happy.

REDAPRICORN.name: Red Apricorn
REDAPRICORN.description: A red Apricorn. It assails your nostrils.

YELLOWAPRICORN.name: Yellow Apricorn
YELLOWAPRICORN.description: A yellow Apricorn. It has an invigorating scent.

BLUEAPRICORN.name: Blue Apricorn
BLUEAPRICORN.description: A blue Apricorn. It smells a bit like grass.

GREENAPRICORN.name: Green Apricorn
GREENAPRICORN.description: A green Apricorn. It has a mysterious, aromatic scent.

PINKAPRICORN.name: Pink Apricorn
PINKAPRICORN.description: A pink Apricorn. It has a nice, sweet scent.

WHITEAPRICORN.name: White Apricorn
WHITEAPRICORN.description: A white Apricorn. It doesn't smell like anything.

BLACKAPRICORN.name: Black Apricorn
BLACKAPRICORN.description: A black Apricorn. It has an indescribable scent.

HELIXFOSSIL.name: Helix Fossil
HELIXFOSSIL.description: A fossil of an ancient Pokémon that lived in the sea. It appears to be part of a seashell.

DOMEFOSSIL.name: Dome Fossil
DOMEFOSSIL.description: A fossil of an ancient Pokémon that lived in the sea. It appears to be part of a shell.

OLDAMBER.name: Old Amber
OLDAMBER.description: A piece of amber that contains the genes of an ancient Pokémon. It is clear with a reddish tint.

ROOTFOSSIL.name: Root Fossil
ROOTFOSSIL.description: A fossil of an ancient Pokémon that lived in the sea. It appears to be part of a plant root.

CLAWFOSSIL.name: Claw Fossil
CLAWFOSSIL.description: A fossil of an ancient Pokémon that lived in the sea. It appears to be part of a claw.

SKULLFOSSIL.name: Skull Fossil
SKULLFOSSIL.description: A fossil from a prehistoric Pokémon that lived on the land. It appears to be part of a head.

ARMORFOSSIL.name: Armor Fossil
ARMORFOSSIL.description: A fossil from a prehistoric Pokémon that lived on the land. It appears to be part of a collar.

COVERFOSSIL.name: Cover Fossil
COVERFOSSIL.description: A fossil of an ancient Pokémon that lived in the sea in ancient times. It appears to be part of its back.

PLUMEFOSSIL.name: Plume Fossil
PLUMEFOSSIL.description: A fossil of an ancient Pokémon that flew in the sky in ancient times. It appears to be part of its wing.

JAWFOSSIL.name: Jaw Fossil
JAWFOSSIL.description: A fossil from a prehistoric Pokémon that once lived on the land. It appears to be part of a large jaw.

SAILFOSSIL.name: Sail Fossil
SAILFOSSIL.description: A fossil from a prehistoric Pokémon that once lived on the land. It looks like the impression from a skin sail.

FOSSILIZEDBIRD.name: Fossilized Bird
FOSSILIZEDBIRD.description: The fossil of an ancient Pokémon that once soared through the sky. What it looked like is a mystery.

FOSSILIZEDFISH.name: Fossilized Fish
FOSSILIZEDFISH.description: The fossil of an ancient Pokémon that once lived in the sea. What it looked like is a mystery.

FOSSILIZEDDRAKE.name: Fossilized Drake
FOSSILIZEDDRAKE.description: The fossil of an ancient Pokémon that once roamed the land. What it looked like is a mystery.

FOSSILIZEDDINO.name: Fossilized Dino
FOSSILIZEDDINO.description: The fossil of an ancient Pokémon that once lived in the sea. What it looked like is a mystery.

VENOMFOSSIL.name: Venom Fossil
VENOMFOSSIL.description: A fossil from a prehistoric Pokémon that once lived on the land. It looks like weird skull.

SHINYFOSSIL.name: Shiny Fossil
SHINYFOSSIL.description: A fossil from a prehistoric Pokémon that once lived on the land. It looks like a helmet.

ENIGMAFOSSIL.name: Enigma Fossil
ENIGMAFOSSIL.description: A fossil from a prehistoric Pokémon that once lived on the land. It looks like a sharp beak with a pointy tail.

PRETTYFEATHER.name: Pretty Feather
PRETTYFEATHER.description: Though this feather is beautiful, it's just a regular feather and has no effect on Pokémon.

TINYMUSHROOM.name: Tiny Mushroom
TINYMUSHROOM.description: A small and rare mushroom. It is sought after by collectors.

BIGMUSHROOM.name: Big Mushroom
BIGMUSHROOM.description: A large and rare mushroom. It is sought after by collectors.

BALMMUSHROOM.name: Balm Mushroom
BALMMUSHROOM.description: A rare mushroom which gives off a nice fragrance. A maniac will buy it for a high price.

PEARL.name: Pearl
PEARL.description: A somewhat-small pearl that sparkles in a pretty silver color. It can be sold cheaply to shops.

BIGPEARL.name: Big Pearl
BIGPEARL.description: A quite-large pearl that sparkles in a pretty silver color. It can be sold at a high price to shops.

PEARLSTRING.name: Pearl String
PEARLSTRING.description: Very large pearls that sparkle in a pretty silver color. A maniac will buy them for a high price.

STARDUST.name: Stardust
STARDUST.description: Lovely, red-colored sand with a loose, silky feel. It can be sold at a high price to shops.

STARPIECE.name: Star Piece
STARPIECE.description: A shard of a pretty gem that sparkles in a red color. It can be sold at a high price to shops.

COMETSHARD.name: Comet Shard
COMETSHARD.description: A shard which fell to the ground when a comet approached. A maniac will buy it for a high price.

NUGGET.name: Nugget
NUGGET.description: A nugget of pure gold that gives off a lustrous gleam. It can be sold at a high price to shops.

BIGNUGGET.name: Big Nugget
BIGNUGGET.description: A big nugget of pure gold that gives off a lustrous gleam. A maniac will buy it for a high price.

HEARTSCALE.name: Heart Scale
HEARTSCALE.description: A pretty, heart-shaped scale that is extremely rare. It glows faintly in the colors of the rainbow.

SLOWPOKETAIL.name: Slowpoke Tail
SLOWPOKETAIL.description: A very tasty tail of something. It can be sold at a high price to shops.

RAREBONE.name: Rare Bone
RAREBONE.description: A bone that is extremely valuable for Pokémon archaeology. It can be sold for a high price to shops.

RELICCOPPER.name: Relic Copper
RELICCOPPER.description: A copper coin used in a civilization about 3,000 years ago. A maniac will buy it for a high price.

RELICSILVER.name: Relic Silver
RELICSILVER.description: A silver coin used in a civilization about 3,000 years ago. A maniac will buy it for a high price.

RELICGOLD.name: Relic Gold
RELICGOLD.description: A gold coin used in a civilization about 3,000 years ago. A maniac will buy it for a high price.

RELICVASE.name: Relic Vase
RELICVASE.description: A vase made in a civilization about 3,000 years ago. A maniac will buy it for a high price.

RELICBAND.name: Relic Band
RELICBAND.description: A bracelet made in a civilization about 3,000 years ago. A maniac will buy it for a high price.

RELICSTATUE.name: Relic Statue
RELICSTATUE.description: A stone figure made in a civilization about 3,000 years ago. A maniac will buy it for a high price.

RELICCROWN.name: Relic Crown
RELICCROWN.description: A crown made in a civilization about 3,000 years ago. A maniac will buy it for a high price.

GROWTHMULCH.name: Growth Mulch
GROWTHMULCH.description: A fertilizer to be spread on soft soil in regions where Berries are grown. A maniac will buy it for a high price.

DAMPMULCH.name: Damp Mulch
DAMPMULCH.description: A fertilizer to be spread on soft soil in regions where Berries are grown. A maniac will buy it for a high price.

STABLEMULCH.name: Stable Mulch
STABLEMULCH.description: A fertilizer to be spread on soft soil in regions where Berries are grown. A maniac will buy it for a high price.

GOOEYMULCH.name: Gooey Mulch
GOOEYMULCH.description: A fertilizer to be spread on soft soil in regions where Berries are grown. A maniac will buy it for a high price.

SHOALSALT.name: Shoal Salt
SHOALSALT.description: Pure salt that can be discovered deep inside the Shoal Cave. A maniac will buy it for a high price.

SHOALSHELL.name: Shoal Shell
SHOALSHELL.description: A pretty seashell that can be found deep inside the Shoal Cave. A maniac will buy it for a high price.

ODDKEYSTONE.name: Odd Keystone
ODDKEYSTONE.description: A vital item that is needed to keep a stone tower from collapsing. Voices can be heard from it occasionally.

REDNECTAR.name: Red Nectar
REDNECTAR.description: A flower nectar obtained at Ula'ula Meadow. It changes the form of certain species of Pokémon.

YELLOWNECTAR.name: Yellow Nectar
YELLOWNECTAR.description: A flower nectar obtained at Melemele Meadow. It changes the form of certain species of Pokémon.

PINKNECTAR.name: Pink Nectar
PINKNECTAR.description: A flower nectar obtained from shrubs on Royal Avenue. It changes the form of certain species of Pokémon.

PURPLENECTAR.name: Purple Nectar
PURPLENECTAR.description: A flower nectar obtained at Poni Meadow. It changes the form of certain species of Pokémon.

AIRBALLOON.name: Air Balloon
AIRBALLOON.description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. The holder will float in the air until hit. Once hit, this item will burst.

BRIGHTPOWDER.name: Bright Powder
BRIGHTPOWDER.description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It casts a tricky glare that lowers the opponent's accuracy.

EVIOLITE.name: Eviolite
EVIOLITE.description: A mysterious evolutionary lump. When held, it raises the Defense and Sp. Def if the holder can still evolve.

FLOATSTONE.name: Float Stone
FLOATSTONE.description: A very light stone. It reduces the weight of a Pokémon when held.

DESTINYKNOT.name: Destiny Knot
DESTINYKNOT.description: A long, thin, bright-red string to be held by a Pokémon. If the holder becomes infatuated, so does the foe.

ROCKYHELMET.name: Rocky Helmet
ROCKYHELMET.description: If the holder of this item takes damage, the attacker will also be damaged upon contact.

ASSAULTVEST.name: Assault Vest
ASSAULTVEST.description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. This offensive vest raises Sp. Def but prevents the use of status moves.

SAFETYGOGGLES.name: Safety Goggles
SAFETYGOGGLES.description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. They protect the holder from weather-related damage and powder.

PROTECTIVEPADS.name: Protective Pads
PROTECTIVEPADS.description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. They protect the holder from effects caused by making contact.

HEAVYDUTYBOOTS.name: Heavy-Duty Boots
HEAVYDUTYBOOTS.description: These boots prevent the effects of traps set on the battlefield.

UTILITYUMBRELLA.name: Utility Umbrella
UTILITYUMBRELLA.description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. This sturdy umbrella protects the holder from the effects of rain and sun.

EJECTBUTTON.name: Eject Button
EJECTBUTTON.description: If the holder is hit by an attack, it will switch with another Pokémon in your party.

EJECTPACK.name: Eject Pack
EJECTPACK.description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. When the holder's stats are lowered, it will be switched out of battle.

REDCARD.name: Red Card
REDCARD.description: A card with a mysterious power. When the holder is struck by a foe, the attacker is removed from battle.

SHEDSHELL.name: Shed Shell
SHEDSHELL.description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. This discarded carapace lets the holder switch out of battle without fail.

SMOKEBALL.name: Smoke Ball
SMOKEBALL.description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It enables the holder to flee from any wild Pokémon without fail.

LUCKYEGG.name: Lucky Egg
LUCKYEGG.description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It is an egg filled with happiness that earns extra Exp. Points in battle.

EXPSHARE.name: Exp. Share
EXPSHARE.description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. The holder gets a share of a battle's Exp. Points without battling.

AMULETCOIN.name: Amulet Coin
AMULETCOIN.description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It doubles a battle's prize money if the holding Pokémon joins in.

SOOTHEBELL.name: Soothe Bell
SOOTHEBELL.description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. The comforting chime of this bell calms the holder, making it friendly.

CLEANSETAG.name: Cleanse Tag
CLEANSETAG.description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It helps keep wild Pokémon away if the holder is the first one in the party.

CHOICEBAND.name: Choice Band
CHOICEBAND.description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. This headband ups Attack, but allows the use of only one move.

CHOICESPECS.name: Choice Specs
CHOICESPECS.description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. These curious glasses boost Sp. Atk but allows the use of only one move.

CHOICESCARF.name: Choice Scarf
CHOICESCARF.description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. This scarf boosts Speed but allows the use of only one move.

HEATROCK.name: Heat Rock
HEATROCK.description: A Pokémon held item that extends the duration of the move Sunny Day used by the holder.

DAMPROCK.name: Damp Rock
DAMPROCK.description: A Pokémon held item that extends the duration of the move Rain Dance used by the holder.

SMOOTHROCK.name: Smooth Rock
SMOOTHROCK.description: A Pokémon held item that extends the duration of the move Sandstorm used by the holder.

ICYROCK.name: Icy Rock
ICYROCK.description: A Pokémon held item that extends the duration of the move Hail used by the holder.

TERRAINEXTENDER.name: Terrain Extender
TERRAINEXTENDER.description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It extends the duration of the terrain caused by the holder.

LIGHTCLAY.name: Light Clay
LIGHTCLAY.description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. Protective moves like Light Screen and Reflect will be effective longer.

GRIPCLAW.name: Grip Claw
GRIPCLAW.description: A Pokémon held item that extends the duration of multiturn attacks like Bind and Wrap.

BINDINGBAND.name: Binding Band
BINDINGBAND.description: A band that increases the power of binding moves when held.

BIGROOT.name: Big Root
BIGROOT.description: A Pokémon held item that boosts the power of HP-stealing moves to let the holder recover more HP.

BLACKSLUDGE.name: Black Sludge
BLACKSLUDGE.description: A held item that gradually restores the HP of Poison-type Pokémon. It inflicts damage on all other types.

LEFTOVERS.name: Leftovers
LEFTOVERS.description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. The holder's HP is gradually restored during battle.

SHELLBELL.name: Shell Bell
SHELLBELL.description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. The holder's HP is restored a little every time it inflicts damage.

MENTALHERB.name: Mental Herb
MENTALHERB.description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It snaps the holder out of infatuation. It can be used only once.

WHITEHERB.name: White Herb
WHITEHERB.description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It restores any lowered stat in battle. It can be used only once.

POWERHERB.name: Power Herb
POWERHERB.description: A single-use item to be held by a Pokémon. It allows the immediate use of a move that charges up first.

ABSORBBULB.name: Absorb Bulb
ABSORBBULB.description: A consumable bulb. If the holder is hit by a Water-type move, its Sp. Atk will rise.

CELLBATTERY.name: Cell Battery
CELLBATTERY.description: A consumable battery. If the holder is hit by an Electric-type move, its Attack will rise.

LUMINOUSMOSS.name: Luminous Moss
LUMINOUSMOSS.description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It boosts Sp. Def if hit by a Water-type attack. It can only be used once.

SNOWBALL.name: Snowball
SNOWBALL.description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It boosts Attack if hit by an Ice-type attack. It can only be used once.

WEAKNESSPOLICY.name: Weakness Policy
WEAKNESSPOLICY.description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. The holder's Attack and Sp. Atk sharply increase if hit by a move it's weak to.

BLUNDERPOLICY.name: Blunder Policy
BLUNDERPOLICY.description: Raises Speed sharply when a Pokémon misses with a move because of accuracy.

THROATSPRAY.name: Throat Spray
THROATSPRAY.description: Raises Sp. Atk when a Pokémon uses a sound-based move.

ADRENALINEORB.name: Adrenaline Orb
ADRENALINEORB.description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It boosts Speed when intimidated. It can be used only once.

ROOMSERVICE.name: Room Service
ROOMSERVICE.description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. Lowers Speed when Trick Room takes effect.

ELECTRICSEED.name: Electric Seed
ELECTRICSEED.description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It boosts Defense on Electric Terrain. It can only be used once.

GRASSYSEED.name: Grassy Seed
GRASSYSEED.description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It boosts Defense on Grassy Terrain. It can only be used once.

MISTYSEED.name: Misty Seed
MISTYSEED.description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It boosts Sp. Def on Misty Terrain. It can only be used once.

PSYCHICSEED.name: Psychic Seed
PSYCHICSEED.description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It boosts Sp. Def on Psychic Terrain. It can only be used once.

LIFEORB.name: Life Orb
LIFEORB.description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It boosts the power of moves, but at the cost of some HP on each hit.

EXPERTBELT.name: Expert Belt
EXPERTBELT.description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It is a well-worn belt that slightly boosts the power of supereffective moves.

METRONOME.name: Metronome
METRONOME.description: A Pokémon held item that boosts a move used consecutively. Its effect is reset if another move is used.

MUSCLEBAND.name: Muscle Band
MUSCLEBAND.description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It is a headband that slightly boosts the power of physical moves.

WISEGLASSES.name: Wise Glasses
WISEGLASSES.description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It is a thick pair of glasses that slightly boosts the power of special moves.

RAZORCLAW.name: Razor Claw
RAZORCLAW.description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It is a sharply hooked claw that ups the holder's critical-hit ratio.

SCOPELENS.name: Scope Lens
SCOPELENS.description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It is a lens that boosts the holder's critical-hit ratio.

WIDELENS.name: Wide Lens
WIDELENS.description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It is a magnifying lens that slightly boosts the accuracy of moves.

ZOOMLENS.name: Zoom Lens
ZOOMLENS.description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. If the holder moves after its target, its accuracy will be boosted.

KINGSROCK.name: King's Rock
KINGSROCK.description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. When the holder inflicts damage, the target may flinch.

RAZORFANG.name: Razor Fang
RAZORFANG.description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It may make foes and allies flinch when the holder inflicts damage.

LAGGINGTAIL.name: Lagging Tail
LAGGINGTAIL.description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It is tremendously heavy and makes the holder move slower than usual.

QUICKCLAW.name: Quick Claw
QUICKCLAW.description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. A light, sharp claw that lets the bearer move first occasionally.

FOCUSBAND.name: Focus Band
FOCUSBAND.description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. The holder may endure a potential KO attack, leaving it with just 1 HP.

FOCUSSASH.name: Focus Sash
FOCUSSASH.description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. If it has full HP, the holder will endure one potential KO attack, leaving 1 HP.

FLAMEORB.name: Flame Orb
FLAMEORB.description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It is a bizarre orb that inflicts a burn on the holder in battle.

TOXICORB.name: Toxic Orb
TOXICORB.description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It is a bizarre orb that badly poisons the holder in battle.

STICKYBARB.name: Sticky Barb
STICKYBARB.description: A held item that damages the holder on every turn. It may latch on to Pokémon that touch the holder.

IRONBALL.name: Iron Ball
IRONBALL.description: A Pokémon held item that cuts Speed. It makes Flying-type and levitating holders susceptible to Ground moves.

RINGTARGET.name: Ring Target
RINGTARGET.description: Moves that would otherwise have no effect will land on the Pokémon that holds it.

MACHOBRACE.name: Macho Brace
MACHOBRACE.description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It is a stiff, heavy brace that promotes strong growth but lowers Speed.

POWERWEIGHT.name: Power Weight
POWERWEIGHT.description: A Pokémon held item that promotes HP gain on leveling, but reduces the Speed stat.

POWERBRACER.name: Power Bracer
POWERBRACER.description: A Pokémon held item that promotes Attack gain on leveling, but reduces the Speed stat.

POWERBELT.name: Power Belt
POWERBELT.description: A Pokémon held item that promotes Defense gain on leveling, but reduces the Speed stat.

POWERLENS.name: Power Lens
POWERLENS.description: A Pokémon held item that promotes Sp. Atk gain on leveling, but reduces the Speed stat.

POWERBAND.name: Power Band
POWERBAND.description: A Pokémon held item that promotes Sp. Def gain on leveling, but reduces the Speed stat.

POWERANKLET.name: Power Anklet
POWERANKLET.description: A Pokémon held item that promotes Speed gain on leveling, but reduces the Speed stat.

LAXINCENSE.name: Lax Incense
LAXINCENSE.description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. The tricky aroma of this incense may make attacks miss the holder.

FULLINCENSE.name: Full Incense
FULLINCENSE.description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. This exotic-smelling incense makes the holder bloated and slow moving.

LUCKINCENSE.name: Luck Incense
LUCKINCENSE.description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It doubles a battle's prize money if the holding Pokémon joins in.

PUREINCENSE.name: Pure Incense
PUREINCENSE.description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It helps keep wild Pokémon away if the holder is the first one in the party.

SEAINCENSE.name: Sea Incense
SEAINCENSE.description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It has a curious aroma that boosts the power of Water-type moves.

WAVEINCENSE.name: Wave Incense
WAVEINCENSE.description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It has a curious aroma that boosts the power of Water-type moves.

ROSEINCENSE.name: Rose Incense
ROSEINCENSE.description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. This exotic-smelling incense boosts the power of Grass-type moves.

ODDINCENSE.name: Odd Incense
ODDINCENSE.description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. This exotic-smelling incense boosts the power of Psychic-type moves.

ROCKINCENSE.name: Rock Incense
ROCKINCENSE.description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. This exotic-smelling incense boosts the power of Rock-type moves.

CHARCOAL.name: Charcoal
CHARCOAL.description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It is a combustible fuel that boosts the power of Fire-type moves.

MYSTICWATER.name: Mystic Water
MYSTICWATER.description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It is a teardrop-shaped gem that ups the power of Water-type moves.

MAGNET.name: Magnet
MAGNET.description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It is a powerful magnet that boosts the power of Electric-type moves.

MIRACLESEED.name: Miracle Seed
MIRACLESEED.description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It is a seed imbued with life that ups the power of Grass-type moves.

NEVERMELTICE.name: Never-Melt Ice
NEVERMELTICE.description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It is a piece of ice that repels heat and boosts Ice-type moves.

BLACKBELT.name: Black Belt
BLACKBELT.description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It is a belt that boosts determination and Fighting-type moves.

POISONBARB.name: Poison Barb
POISONBARB.description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It is a small, poisonous barb that ups the power of Poison-type moves.

SOFTSAND.name: Soft Sand
SOFTSAND.description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It is a loose, silky sand that boosts the power of Ground-type moves.

SHARPBEAK.name: Sharp Beak

SMILEBURST.description: A special candy manufactured by the Cionsta company. It raises the happiness of a Pokemon

LAVACOOKIE.name: Lava Cookie
LAVACOOKIE.description: Lavaridge Town's local specialty. It heals all the status problems of one Pokémon.

OLDGATEAU.name: Old Gateau
OLDGATEAU.description: Old Chateau's hidden specialty. It heals all the status problems of a single Pokémon.

CASTELIACONE.name: Casteliacone
CASTELIACONE.description: Castelia City's specialty, soft-serve ice cream. It heals all the status problems of a single Pokémon.

LUMIOSEGALETTE.name: Lumiose Galette
LUMIOSEGALETTE.description: A popular treat in Lumiose City. It can be used once to heal all the status conditions of a Pokémon.

SHALOURSABLE.name: Shalour Sable
SHALOURSABLE.description: Shalour City's famous shortbread. It can be used once to heal all the status conditions of a Pokémon.

BIGMALASADA.name: Big Malasada
BIGMALASADA.description: The Alola region's specialty--fried bread. It can be used once to heal all the status conditions of a Pokémon.

MINREVIVE.name: Min Revive
MINREVIVE.description: A medicine that revives a fainted Pokémon. It restores a little bit of the Pokémon's maximum HP.

REVIVE.name: Revive
REVIVE.description: A medicine that revives a fainted Pokémon. It restores half the Pokémon's maximum HP.

MAXREVIVE.name: Max Revive
MAXREVIVE.description: A medicine that revives a fainted Pokémon. It fully restores the Pokémon's HP.

BERRYJUICE.name: Berry Juice
BERRYJUICE.description: A 100% pure juice made of Berries. It restores the HP of one Pokémon by just 20 points.

SWEETHEART.name: Sweet Heart
SWEETHEART.description: Very sweet chocolate. It restores the HP of one Pokémon by only 20 points.

FRESHWATER.name: Fresh Water
FRESHWATER.description: Water with high mineral content. It can be used to restore 30 HP to a single Pokémon.

SODAPOP.name: Soda Pop
SODAPOP.description: A highly carbonated soda drink. It can be used to restore 50 HP to a single Pokémon.

LEMONADE.name: Lemonade
LEMONADE.description: A very sweet and refreshing drink. It can be used to restore 70 HP to a single Pokémon.

MOOMOOMILK.name: Moomoo Milk
MOOMOOMILK.description: Milk with a very high nutrition content. It restores the HP of one Pokémon by 100 points.

ENERGYPOWDER.name: Energy Powder
ENERGYPOWDER.description: A very bitter medicinal powder. It can be used to restore 60 HP to a single Pokémon.

ENERGYROOT.name: Energy Root
ENERGYROOT.description: An extremely bitter medicinal root. It can be used to restore 120 HP to a single Pokémon.

HEALPOWDER.name: Heal Powder
HEALPOWDER.description: A very bitter medicine powder. It heals all the status problems of a single Pokémon.

REVIVALHERB.name: Revival Herb
REVIVALHERB.description: A very bitter medicinal herb. It revives a fainted Pokémon, fully restoring its HP.

MAXHONEY.name: Max Honey
MAXHONEY.description: Honey that Dynamax Vespiquen produces. It has the same effect as a Max Revive.

ETHER.name: Ether
ETHER.description: It restores the PP of a Pokémon's selected move by a maximum of 10 points.

MAXETHER.name: Max Ether
MAXETHER.description: It fully restores the PP of a single selected move that has been learned by the target Pokémon.

ELIXIR.name: Elixir
ELIXIR.description: It restores the PP of all the moves learned by the targeted Pokémon by 10 points each.

MAXELIXIR.name: Max Elixir
MAXELIXIR.description: It fully restores the PP of all the moves learned by the targeted Pokémon.

PPUP.name: PP Up
PPUP.description: It slightly raises the maximum PP of a selected move that has been learned by the target Pokémon.

PPMAX.name: PP Max
PPMAX.description: It maximally raises the top PP of a selected move that has been learned by the target Pokémon.

HPUP.name: Green Gummy
HPUP.description: It raises the HP IV of a single Pokémon by 10.

PROTEIN.name: Red Gummy
PROTEIN.description: It raises the Attack IV of a single Pokémon by 10.

IRON.name: Blue Gummy
IRON.description: It raises the Defense IV of a single Pokémon by 10.

CALCIUM.name: Violet Gummy
CALCIUM.description: It raises the Special Attack IV of a single Pokémon by 10.

ZINC.name: Yellow Gummy
ZINC.description: It raises the Special Defense IV of a single Pokémon by 10.

CARBOS.name: Orange Gummy
CARBOS.description: It raises the Speed IV of a single Pokémon by 10.

HEALTHFEATHER.name: Health Feather
HEALTHFEATHER.description: It's useless, might aswell sell it.

MUSCLEFEATHER.name: Muscle Feather
MUSCLEFEATHER.description: It's useless, might aswell sell it.

RESISTFEATHER.name: Resist Feather
RESISTFEATHER.description: It's useless, might aswell sell it.

GENIUSFEATHER.name: Genius Feather
GENIUSFEATHER.description: It's useless, might aswell sell it.

CLEVERFEATHER.name: Clever Feather
CLEVERFEATHER.description: It's useless, might aswell sell it.

SWIFTFEATHER.name: Swift Feather
SWIFTFEATHER.description: It's useless, might aswell sell it.

LONELYMINT.name: Lonely Mint
LONELYMINT.description: When a Pokémon smells this mint, its Attack will grow more easily, but its Defense will grow more slowly.

ADAMANTMINT.name: Adamant Mint
ADAMANTMINT.description: When a Pokémon smells this mint, its Attack will grow more easily, but its Sp. Atk will grow more slowly.

NAUGHTYMINT.name: Naughty Mint
NAUGHTYMINT.description: When a Pokémon smells this mint, its Attack will grow more easily, but its Sp. Def will grow more slowly.

BRAVEMINT.name: Brave Mint
BRAVEMINT.description: When a Pokémon smells this mint, its Attack will grow more easily, but its Speed will grow more slowly.

BOLDMINT.name: Bold Mint
BOLDMINT.description: When a Pokémon smells this mint, its Defense will grow more easily, but its Attack will grow more slowly.

IMPISHMINT.name: Impish Mint
IMPISHMINT.description: When a Pokémon smells this mint, its Defense will grow more easily, but its Sp. Atk will grow more slowly.

LAXMINT.name: Lax Mint
LAXMINT.description: When a Pokémon smells this mint, its Defense will grow more easily, but its Sp. Def will grow more slowly.

RELAXEDMINT.name: Relaxed Mint
RELAXEDMINT.description: When a Pokémon smells this mint, its Defense will grow more easily, but its Speed will grow more slowly.

MODESTMINT.name: Modest Mint
MODESTMINT.description: When a Pokémon smells this mint, its Sp. Atk will grow more easily, but its Attack will grow more slowly.

MILDMINT.name: Mild Mint
MILDMINT.description: When a Pokémon smells this mint, its Sp. Atk will grow more easily, but its Defense will grow more slowly.

RASHMINT.name: Rash Mint
RASHMINT.description: When a Pokémon smells this mint, its Sp. Atk will grow more easily, but its Sp. Def will grow more slowly.

QUIETMINT.name: Quiet Mint
QUIETMINT.description: When a Pokémon smells this mint, its Sp. Atk will grow more easily, but its Speed will grow more slowly.

CALMMINT.name: Calm Mint
CALMMINT.description: When a Pokémon smells this mint, its Sp. Def will grow more easily, but its Attack will grow more slowly.

GENTLEMINT.name: Gentle Mint
GENTLEMINT.description: When a Pokémon smells this mint, its Sp. Def will grow more easily, but its Defense will grow more slowly.

CAREFULMINT.name: Careful Mint
CAREFULMINT.description: When a Pokémon smells this mint, its Sp. Def will grow more easily, but its Sp. Atk will grow more slowly.

SASSYMINT.name: Sassy Mint
SASSYMINT.description: When a Pokémon smells this mint, its Sp. Def will grow more easily, but its Speed will grow more slowly.

TIMIDMINT.name: Timid Mint
TIMIDMINT.description: When a Pokémon smells this mint, its Speed will grow more easily, but its Attack will grow more slowly.

HASTYMINT.name: Hasty Mint
HASTYMINT.description: When a Pokémon smells this mint, its Speed will grow more easily, but its Defense will grow more slowly.

JOLLYMINT.name: Jolly Mint
JOLLYMINT.description: When a Pokémon smells this mint, its Speed will grow more easily, but its Sp. Atk will grow more slowly.

NAIVEMINT.name: Naive Mint
NAIVEMINT.description: When a Pokémon smells this mint, its Speed will grow more easily, but its Sp. Def will grow more slowly.

SERIOUSMINT.name: Serious Mint
SERIOUSMINT.description: When a Pokémon smells this mint, all of its stats will grow at an equal rate.

ABILITYCAPSULE.name: Ability Capsule
ABILITYCAPSULE.description: A capsule that allows a Pokémon with two Abilities to switch between these Abilities when it is used.

ABILITYPATCH.name: Ability Patch
ABILITYPATCH.description: A patch that allows a Pokémon with a regular Ability to have a rare Ability.

EXPCANDYI.name: Exp. Candy I
EXPCANDYI.description: When consumed, it will grant a single Pokémon 75 Exp. Points.

EXPCANDYII.name: Exp. Candy II
EXPCANDYII.description: When consumed, it will grant a single Pokémon 250 Exp. Points.

EXPCANDYIII.name: Exp. Candy III
EXPCANDYIII.description: When consumed, it will grant a single Pokémon 800 Exp. Points.

EXPCANDYIV.name: Exp. Candy IV
EXPCANDYIV.description: When consumed, it will grant a single Pokémon 2000 Exp. Points.

EXPCANDYV.name: Exp. Candy V
EXPCANDYV.description: When consumed, it will grant a single Pokémon 5000 Exp. Points.

EXPCANDYVI.name: Exp. Candy VI
EXPCANDYVI.description: When consumed, it will grant a single Pokémon 10000 Exp. Points.

RARECANDY.name: Rare Candy
RARECANDY.description: A candy that is packed with energy. It raises the level of a single Pokémon by one.

ULTRABALL.name: Ultra Ball
ULTRABALL.description: An ultra-performance Ball that provides a higher Pokémon catch rate than a Great Ball.

GREATBALL.name: Great Ball
GREATBALL.description: A good, high-performance Ball that provides a higher Pokémon catch rate than a standard Poké Ball.

POKEBALL.name: Poké Ball
POKEBALL.description: A device for catching wild Pokémon. It is thrown like a ball at the target. It is designed as a capsule system.

SAFARIBALL.name: Safari Ball
SAFARIBALL.description: A special Poké Ball that is used only in the Safari Zone. It is decorated in a camouflage pattern.

SPORTBALL.name: Sport Ball
SPORTBALL.description: A special Poké Ball for the Bug-Catching Contest.

NETBALL.name: Net Ball
NETBALL.description: A somewhat different Poké Ball that works especially well on Water- and Bug-type Pokémon.

DIVEBALL.name: Dive Ball
DIVEBALL.description: A somewhat different Poké Ball that works especially well on Pokémon that live underwater.

NESTBALL.name: Nest Ball
NESTBALL.description: A somewhat different Poké Ball that works especially well on weaker Pokémon in the wild.

REPEATBALL.name: Repeat Ball
REPEATBALL.description: A somewhat different Poké Ball that works especially well on Pokémon species that were previously caught.

TIMERBALL.name: Timer Ball
TIMERBALL.description: A somewhat different Ball that becomes progressively better the more turns there are in a battle.

LUXURYBALL.name: Luxury Ball
LUXURYBALL.description: A comfortable Poké Ball that makes a caught wild Pokémon quickly grow friendly.

PREMIERBALL.name: Premier Ball
PREMIERBALL.description: A somewhat rare Poké Ball that has been specially made to commemorate an event of some sort.

DUSKBALL.name: Dusk Ball
DUSKBALL.description: A somewhat different Poké Ball that makes it easier to catch wild Pokémon at night or in dark places like caves.

HEALBALL.name: Heal Ball
HEALBALL.description: A remedial Poké Ball that restores the caught Pokémon's HP and eliminates any status problem.

QUICKBALL.name: Quick Ball
QUICKBALL.description: A somewhat different Poké Ball that provides a better catch rate if used at the start of a wild encounter.

CHERISHBALL.name: Cherish Ball
CHERISHBALL.description: A quite rare Poké Ball that has been specially crafted to commemorate an occasion of some sort.

FASTBALL.name: Fast Ball
FASTBALL.description: A Poké Ball that makes it easier to catch fast Pokémon.

LEVELBALL.name: Level Ball
LEVELBALL.description: A Poké Ball for catching Pokémon that are a lower level than your own.

LUREBALL.name: Lure Ball
LUREBALL.description: A Poké Ball for catching Pokémon hooked by a Rod when fishing.

HEAVYBALL.name: Heavy Ball
HEAVYBALL.description: A Poké Ball for catching very heavy Pokémon.

LOVEBALL.name: Love Ball
LOVEBALL.description: A Poké Ball for catching Pokémon that are the opposite gender of your Pokémon.

FRIENDBALL.name: Friend Ball
FRIENDBALL.description: A Poké Ball that makes caught Pokémon more friendly.

MOONBALL.name: Moon Ball
MOONBALL.description: A Poké Ball for catching Pokémon that evolve using the Moon Stone.

DREAMBALL.name: Dream Ball
DREAMBALL.description: A somewhat different Poké Ball that makes it easier to catch wild Pokémon while they're asleep.

BEASTBALL.name: Beast Ball
BEASTBALL.description: A special Poké Ball designed to catch Ultra Beasts. It has a low success rate for catching others.

TM01.name: TM01
TM01.description: The user focuses its mind before launching a punch. This move fails if the user is hit before it is used.

TM02.name: TM02
TM02.description: The user slashes the target with huge sharp claws.

TM03.name: TM03
TM03.description: The user attacks the target with a pulsing blast of water. This may also confuse the target.

TM04.name: TM04
TM04.description: The user quietly focuses its mind and calms its spirit to raise its Sp. Atk and Sp. Def stats.

TM05.name: TM05
TM05.description: The target is scared off, and a different Pokémon is dragged out. In the wild, this ends the battle.

TM06.name: TM06
TM06.description: A move that leaves the target badly poisoned. Its poison damage worsens every turn.

TM07.name: TM07
TM07.description: The user summons a hailstorm lasting five turns. It damages all Pokémon except Ice types.

TM08.name: TM08
TM08.description: The user tenses its muscles to bulk up its body, raising both its Attack and Defense stats.

TM09.name: TM09
TM09.description: The user forcefully shoots seeds at the target two to five times in a row.

TM10.name: TM10
TM10.description: The user attacks with a barrage of magical leaves.

TM11.name: TM11
TM11.description: The user intensifies the sun for five turns, powering up Fire-type moves and weakening Water-type moves.

TM12.name: TM12
TM12.description: The target is taunted into a rage that allows it to use only attack moves for three turns.

TM13.name: TM13
TM13.description: The target is struck with an icy-cold beam of energy. This may also leave the target frozen.

TM14.name: TM14
TM14.description: A howling blizzard is summoned to strike opposing Pokémon. This may also leave them frozen.

TM15.name: TM15
TM15.description: The target is attacked with a powerful beam. The user can't move on the next turn.

TM16.name: TM16
TM16.description: A wondrous wall of light is put up to reduce damage from special attacks for five turns.

TM17.name: TM17
TM17.description: A nutrient-draining attack. The user's HP is restored by half the damage taken by the target.

TM18.name: TM18
TM18.description: Deals damage and raises the user's speed by one stage.

TM19.name: TM19
TM19.description: The user summons a heavy rain for five turns, powering up Water-type moves and weakening Fire-type ones.

TM20.name: TM20
TM20.description: The user creates a protective field that prevents status conditions for five turns.

TM21.name: TM21
TM21.description: The user damages opposing Pokémon by emitting a powerful flash.

TM22.name: TM22
TM22.description: In this two-turn attack, the user gathers light, then blasts a bundled beam on the next turn.

TM23.name: TM23
TM23.description: The target is slammed with a steel-hard tail. This may also lower the target's Defense stat.

TM24.name: TM24
TM24.description: A strong electric blast crashes down on the target. This may also leave the target with paralysis.

TM25.name: TM25
TM25.description: A wicked thunderbolt is dropped on the target to inflict damage. This may also leave them with paralysis.

TM26.name: TM26
TM26.description: The user sets off an earthquake that strikes every Pokémon around it.

TM27.name: TM27
TM27.description: The user makes a swift attack on the target's legs, which lowers the target's Speed stat.

TM28.name: TM28
TM28.description: The user burrows into the ground, then attacks on the next turn. It can also be used to exit dungeons.

TM29.name: TM29
TM29.description: Deals damage and raises the user's speed by one stage.

TM30.name: TM30
TM30.description: The user hurls a shadowy blob at the target. This may also lower the target's Sp. Def stat.

TM31.name: TM31
TM31.description: The user attacks with a swift chop. It can also break barriers, such as Light Screen and Reflect.

TM32.name: TM32
TM32.description: By moving rapidly, the user makes illusory copies of itself to raise its evasiveness.

TM33.name: TM33
TM33.description: A wondrous wall of light is put up to reduce damage from physical attacks for five turns.

TM34.name: TM34
TM34.description: The user strikes the target with a quick jolt of electricity. This attack never misses.

TM35.name: TM35
TM35.description: The target is scorched with an intense blast of fire. This may also leave the target with a burn.

TM36.name: TM36
TM36.description: Unsanitary sludge is hurled at the target. This may also poison the target.

TM37.name: TM37
TM37.description: The target is punched with a fiery fist. It may leave the target with a burn.

TM38.name: TM38
TM38.description: The target is attacked with an intense blast of all-consuming fire. This may also leave them with a burn.

TM39.name: TM39
TM39.description: The user attacks the foe with an echoing voice. If this move is used every turn, it does greater damage.

TM40.name: TM40
TM40.description: The user confounds the target with speed, then slashes. This attack never misses.

TM41.name: TM41
TM41.description: The user torments and enrages the target, making it incapable of using the same move twice in a row.

TM42.name: TM42
TM42.description: This attack move doubles its power if the user is poisoned, burned, or paralyzed.

TM43.name: TM43
TM43.description: After making its attack, the user rushes back to switch places with a party Pokémon in waiting.

TM44.name: TM44
TM44.description: The user goes to sleep for two turns. This fully restores the user's HP and heals any status conditions.

TM45.name: TM45
TM45.description: If it is the opposite gender of the user, the target becomes infatuated and less likely to attack.

TM46.name: TM46
TM46.description: The user attacks and steals the target's held item simultaneously.

TM47.name: TM47
TM47.description: The target is hit with wings of steel. This may also raise the user's Defense stat.

TM48.name: TM48
TM48.description: The user employs its psychic power to exchange Abilities with the target.

TM49.name: TM49
TM49.description: The user shoots boiling hot water at its target. This may also leave the target with a burn.

TM50.name: TM50
TM50.description: The user attacks the target at full power. The attack's recoil harshly lowers the user's Sp. Atk stat.

TM51.name: TM51
TM51.description: The user lands and rests its body. This move restores the user's HP by up to half of its max HP.

TM52.name: TM52
TM52.description: The user heightens its mental focus and unleashes its power. This may also lower the target's Sp. Def stat.

TM53.name: TM53
TM53.description: The user draws power from nature and fires it at the target. This may also lower the target's Sp. Def stat.

TM54.name: TM54
TM54.description: A restrained attack that prevents the target from fainting. The target is left with at least 1 HP.

TM55.name: TM55
TM55.description: If the target's HP is half or less, this attack will hit with double the power.

TM56.name: TM56
TM56.description: The user flings its held item at the target to attack. This move's power and effects depend on the item.

TM57.name: TM57
TM57.description: The user attacks the target with an electric charge. The user may use any remaining charge to raise its Sp. Atk.

TM58.name: TM58
TM58.description: The user endures any attack with at least 1 HP. Its chance of failing rises if it is used in succession.

TM59.name: TM59
TM59.description: The target is attacked with a shock wave generated by the user's gaping mouth.

TM60.name: TM60
TM60.description: An energy-draining punch. The user's HP is restored by half the damage taken by the target.

TM61.name: TM61
TM61.description: The user shoots a sinister flame at the target to inflict a burn.

TM62.name: TM62
TM62.description: The user generates a damaging sound wave by vibration. This may also lower the target's Sp. Def stat.

TM63.name: TM63
TM63.description: The user stimulates its brain by thinking bad thoughts. This sharply raises the user's Sp. Atk stat.

TM64.name: TM64
TM64.description: The user attacks everything around it by causing a tremendous explosion. The user faints upon using this move.

TM65.name: TM65
TM65.description: The user slashes with a sharp claw made from shadows. Critical hits land more easily.

TM66.name: TM66
TM66.description: The user stores power, then attacks. If the user moves after the target, this attack's power will be doubled.

TM67.name: TM67
TM67.description: The user negates effects and damage from a move for one turn.

TM68.name: TM68
TM68.description: The user charges at the target using every bit of its power. The user can't move on the next turn.

TM69.name: TM69
TM69.description: The user polishes its body to reduce drag. This sharply raises the Speed stat.

TM70.name: TM70
TM70.description: The user flashes a light that lowers the target's accuracy. It can also be used to illuminate caves.

TM71.name: TM71
TM71.description: The user stabs the target from below with sharpened stones. Critical hits land more easily.

TM72.name: TM72
TM72.description: The power of this attack move is doubled if the user has been hurt by the target in the same turn.

TM73.name: TM73
TM73.description: The user launches a weak jolt of electricity that paralyzes the target.

TM74.name: TM74
TM74.description: The user tackles with a high-speed spin. This move is stronger the slower the user is than the target.

TM75.name: TM75
TM75.description: A frenetic dance to uplift the fighting spirit. This sharply raises the user's Attack stat.

TM76.name: TM76
TM76.description: The user lays a trap of levitating stones around the opposing team that hurt Pokémon that switch in.

TM77.name: TM77
TM77.description: The user hypnotizes itself into copying any stat change made by the target.

TM78.name: TM78
TM78.description: The user yells as if it's ranting about something, which lowers the Sp. Atk stats of opposing Pokémon.

TM79.name: TM79
TM79.description: The user releases a horrible aura imbued with dark thoughts. This may also make the target flinch.

TM80.name: TM80
TM80.description: Large boulders are hurled at opposing Pokémon to inflict damage. This may also make them flinch.

TM81.name: TM81
TM81.description: The user slashes at the target by crossing its scythes or claws as if they were a pair of scissors.

TM82.name: TM82
TM82.description: While it is asleep, the user randomly uses one of the moves it knows.

TM83.name: TM83
TM83.description: The user strikes everything around it by stomping down on the ground. This lowers the Speed of those hit.

TM84.name: TM84
TM84.description: The target is stabbed with a tentacle, arm, or the like steeped in poison. This may also poison them.

TM85.name: TM85
TM85.description: The user eats the dreams of a sleeping target. The user's HP is restored by half the damage dealt.

TM86.name: TM86
TM86.description: The user snares the target with grass and trips it. The heavier the target, the strong the move is.

TM87.name: TM87
TM87.description: The user enrages and confuses the target. However, this also sharply raises the target's Attack stat.

TM88.name: TM88
TM88.description: The user pecks the target. If the target is holding a Berry, the user eats it and gains its effect.

TM89.name: TM89
TM89.description: After making its attack, the user rushes back to switch places with a party Pokémon in waiting.

TM90.name: TM90
TM90.description: The user creates a substitute for itself using some of its HP. The substitute serves as a decoy.

TM91.name: TM91
TM91.description: The user gathers all its light energy and releases it all at once. This may also lower the target's Sp. Def stat.

TM92.name: TM92
TM92.description: The user creates a bizarre area in which slower Pokémon get to move first for five turns.

TM93.name: TM93
TM93.description: The target is cut with a scythe or claw.

TM94.name: TM94
TM94.description: The user flies up into the sky and then strikes its target on the next turn.

TM95.name: TM95
TM95.description: The user attacks everything around it by swamping its surroundings with a giant wave.

TM96.name: TM96
TM96.description: The target is slugged with a punch thrown at maximum power.

TM97.name: TM97
TM97.description: A strong wind blows away the target's barriers, such as Reflect, and lowers their evasiveness.

TM98.name: TM98
TM98.description: The user attacks with a punch that may lower the target's Defense stat.

TM99.name: TM99
TM99.description: The user charges at the target and may make it flinch.

TM100.name: TM100
TM100.description: A charging attack that may also leave the foe confused.

TM101.name: TM101
TM101.description: The user attacks in an uproar for three turns. During that time, no Pokémon can fall asleep.

TM102.name: TM102
TM102.description: The target is punched with an icy fist. It may also leave the target frozen.

TM103.name: TM103
TM103.description: The user raises its allies’ critical hit ratio with a draconic cry. This rouses Dragon types more.

TM104.name: TM104
TM104.description: The user performs a beautiful dance. It boosts the user's Sp. Atk, Sp. Def, and Speed stats.

TM105.name: TM105
TM105.description: Attacks the target by controlling its item. The move fails if the target doesn't have an item.

TM106.name: TM106
TM106.description: A spin attack covered by ice deals damage. This move's spinning removes active terrains.

TR13.name: TR13
TR13.description: The user attacks dealing damage based on their hidden power type.

TR14.name: TR14
TR14.description: Boulders are hurled at the target. It also lowers the target's Speed by preventing its movement.

TR15.name: TR15
TR15.description: The user attacks the target with a pulsing blast of water. It may also confuse the target.

TR16.name: TR16
TR16.description: After making its attack, the user rushes back to switch places with a party Pokémon in waiting.

TR17.name: TR17
TR17.description: The user drenches the foe in a special poisonous liquid. Its power doubles if the target is poisoned.

TR18.name: TR18
TR18.description: The target is punched with an electrified fist. It may also leave the target with paralysis.

TR19.name: TR19
TR19.description: Summons a five-turn sandstorm to hurt all combatants except the Rock, Ground, and Steel types.

TR20.name: TR20
TR20.description: The user attacks with a blade of air that slices even the sky. It may also make the target flinch.

TR21.name: TR21
TR21.description: A column of grass hits the foes. When used with its water equivalent, it creates a vast swamp.

TR22.name: TR22
TR22.description: Star-shaped rays are shot at the opposing team. This attack never misses.

TR23.name: TR23
TR23.description: A column of fire hits opposing Pokémon. When used with its Grass equivalent, it makes a sea of fire.

TR24.name: TR24
TR24.description: A column of water strikes the target. When combined with its fire equivalent, it makes a rainbow.

TR25.name: TR25
TR25.description: The user slashes with a sharp claw made from shadows. Critical hits land more easily.

TR26.name: TR26
TR26.description: The user draws power from nature and fires it at the target. This may also lower the target's Sp. Def stat.

TR35.name: TR35
TR35.description: The user attacks with a song. Others can join in the Round and make the attack do greater damage.

TR36.name: TR36
TR36.description: The user exhales a heated breath to attack. It may also inflict a burn.

TR37.name: TR37
TR37.description: The user crashes into its target while rotating its body like a drill. Critical hits land more easily.

TR85.name: TR85
TR85.description: The user is roused, and its Attack and Sp. Atk stats increase.

TR100.name: TR100
TR100.description: The user sends a distracting orb of light to confuse the target.

TR05.name: TR05
TR05.description: The target is struck with an icy-cold beam of energy. It may also freeze the target solid.

TR06.name: TR06
TR06.description: Power doubles if opponent's HP is less than 50%.

TR07.name: TR07
TR07.description: The user lays a trap of spikes at the opposing team's feet. The trap hurts Pokémon that switch into battle.

HM01.name: HM01
HM01.description: The target is cut with a scythe or claw. This can also be used to cut down thin trees.

HM02.name: HM02
HM02.description: The user soars and then strikes on the next turn. This can also be used to fly to any familiar town.

HM03.name: HM03
HM03.description: Attacks everything by swamping the surroundings with a giant wave. This can also be used to cross water.

HM04.name: HM04
HM04.description: The target is slugged with a punch thrown at maximum power. This can also be used to move heavy boulders.

HM05.name: HM05
HM05.description: The user charges at the target and may make it flinch. It can also be used to climb a waterfall.

HM06.name: HM06
HM06.description: The user attacks with a punch that may lower the target's Defense stat.

HM10.name: HM10
HM10.description: The user freezes its bottom half and charges at the opponent. It can be used to freeze and then traverse certain bodies of water.

DIREHIT3.name: Dire Hit 3

GUARDSPEC.description: An item that prevents stat reduction among the Trainer's party Pokémon for five turns after use.

RESETURGE.name: Reset Urge
RESETURGE.description: When used, it restores any stat changes of an ally Pokémon.

ABILITYURGE.name: Ability Urge
ABILITYURGE.description: When used, it activates the Ability of an ally Pokémon.

ITEMURGE.name: Item Urge
ITEMURGE.description: When used, it causes an ally Pokémon to use its held item.

ITEMDROP.name: Item Drop
ITEMDROP.description: When used, it causes an ally Pokémon to drop a held item.

BLUEFLUTE.name: Blue Flute
BLUEFLUTE.description: A blue flute made from blown glass. Its melody awakens a single Pokémon from sleep.

YELLOWFLUTE.name: Yellow Flute
YELLOWFLUTE.description: A yellow flute made from blown glass. Its melody snaps a single Pokémon out of confusion.

REDFLUTE.name: Red Flute
REDFLUTE.description: A red flute made from blown glass. Its melody snaps a single Pokémon out of infatuation.

POKEDOLL.name: Poké Doll
POKEDOLL.description: A doll that attracts Pokémon. Use it to flee from any battle with a wild Pokémon.

FLUFFYTAIL.name: Fluffy Tail
FLUFFYTAIL.description: An item that attracts Pokémon. Use it to flee from any battle with a wild Pokémon.

POKETOY.name: Poké Toy
POKETOY.description: An item that attracts Pokémon. Use it to flee from any battle with a wild Pokémon.

BICYCLE.name: Bicycle
BICYCLE.description: A folding Bicycle that enables much faster movement than the Running Shoes.

OLDROD.name: Old Rod
OLDROD.description: An old and beat-up fishing rod. Use it by any body of water to fish for wild aquatic Pokémon.

GOODROD.name: Good Rod
GOODROD.description: A new, good-quality fishing rod. Use it by any body of water to fish for wild aquatic Pokémon.

SUPERROD.name: Super Rod
SUPERROD.description: An awesome, high-tech fishing rod. Use it by any body of water to fish for wild aquatic Pokémon.

ITEMFINDER.name: Itemfinder
ITEMFINDER.description: A device used for finding items. If there is a hidden item nearby when it is used, it emits a signal.

DOWSINGMACHINE.name: Dowsing Machine
DOWSINGMACHINE.description: It checks for unseen items in the area and makes noise and lights when it finds something.

POKERADAR.name: Poké Radar
POKERADAR.description: A tool that can search out Pokémon that are hiding in grass. Its battery is recharged as you walk.

TOWNMAP.name: Town Map
TOWNMAP.description: A very convenient map that can be viewed anytime. It even shows your present location.

ESCAPEROPE.name: Escape Rope
ESCAPEROPE.description: A long, durable rope. Use it to escape instantly from a cave or a dungeon.

COINCASE.name: Point Card
COINCASE.description: A card that shows your trainer point amount.

POKEFLUTE.name: Poké Flute
POKEFLUTE.description: A flute that is said to instantly awaken any Pokémon. It has a lovely tone.

SOOTSACK.name: Soot Sack
SOOTSACK.description: A sack used to gather and hold volcanic ash.

SILPHSCOPE.name: Silph Scope
SILPHSCOPE.description: A scope that makes unseeable Pokémon visible. It is made by Silph Co.

DEVONSCOPE.name: Devon Scope
DEVONSCOPE.description: A device by Devon that signals any unseeable Pokémon.

SQUIRTBOTTLE.name: Squirt Bottle
SQUIRTBOTTLE.description: A watering can shaped like a Squirtle. It helps promote healthy growth of Berries planted in soft soil.

SPRAYDUCK.name: Sprayduck
SPRAYDUCK.description: A watering can shaped like a Psyduck. It helps promote healthy growth of Berries planted in soft soil.

WAILMERPAIL.name: Wailmer Pail
WAILMERPAIL.description: A nifty watering pail. Use it to promote strong growth in Berries planted in soft soil.

SPRINKLOTAD.name: Sprinklotad
SPRINKLOTAD.description: A watering can shaped like a Lotad. It helps promote the healthy growth of any Berries planted in soft soil.

GRACIDEA.name: Gracidea
GRACIDEA.description: A flower sometimes bundled in bouquets to convey gratitude on special occasions like birthdays.

REVEALGLASS.name: Reveal Glass
REVEALGLASS.description: A glass that reveals the truth. It is a mysterious glass that returns a Pokémon back to its original shape.

PRISONBOTTLE.name: Prison Bottle
PRISONBOTTLE.description: A bottle believed to have been used to seal away the power of a certain Pokémon long, long ago.

ROTOMCATALOG.name: Rotom Catalog
ROTOMCATALOG.description: A catalog of devices that Rotom like. Use the catalog to have Rotom hop in and out of the devices listed within.

ZYGARDECUBE.name: Zygarde Cube
ZYGARDECUBE.description: An item in which Zygarde Cores and Cells are gathered. You can also use it to change Zygarde's forms.

DNASPLICERS.name: DNA Splicers
DNASPLICERS.description: A splicer that fuses Kyurem and a certain Pokémon. They are said to have been one in the beginning.

DNASPLICERSUSED.name: DNA Splicers
DNASPLICERSUSED.description: A splicer that separates Kyurem and a certain Pokémon when they have been fused.

NSOLARIZER.name: N-Solarizer
NSOLARIZER.description: A machine to fuse Necrozma, which needs light, and Solgaleo.

NSOLARIZERUSED.name: N-Solarizer
NSOLARIZERUSED.description: A machine to separate Necrozma, which needed light, from Solgaleo.

NLUNARIZER.name: N-Lunarizer
NLUNARIZER.description: A machine to fuse Necrozma, which needs light, and Lunala.

NLUNARIZERUSED.name: N-Lunarizer
NLUNARIZERUSED.description: A machine to separate Necrozma, which needed light, from Lunala.

REINSOFUNITY.name: Reins of Unity
REINSOFUNITY.description: Reins that people presented to the king. They unite Calyrex with its beloved steed.

REINSOFUNITYUSED.name: Reins of Unity
REINSOFUNITYUSED.description: Reins that people presented to the king. They separate Calyrex and its beloved steed.

OVALCHARM.name: Oval Charm

SHINYCHARM.name: Shiny Charm
SHINYCHARM.description: A shiny charm said to increase the chance of finding a Shiny Pokémon.

CATCHINGCHARM.name: Catching Charm
CATCHINGCHARM.description: A charm said to increase the chance of getting a critical catch. The charm doesn't shake much.

EXPCHARM.name: Exp. Charm
EXPCHARM.description: A charm that increases the Exp. Points that Pokémon can get. A machine-like object is inside it.

MEGARING.name: Mega Ring
MEGARING.description: This ring contains an untold power that somehow enables Pokémon carrying Mega Stones to Mega Evolve.

POKEMONBOXLINK.name: Pokémon Box Link
POKEMONBOXLINK.description: A device that allows you to access the Pokémon storage system. There are some places where it won't work.

AURORATICKET.name: Aurora Ticket
AURORATICKET.description: A ticket required to board the ship to Doxy Island. It glows beautifully.

AVAROSFLUTE.name: Avaros Flute
AVAROSFLUTE.description: A light blue flute. It's cold to the touch.

AVAROSFLUTE2.name: Avaros Flute
AVAROSFLUTE2.description: A light blue flute. It's cold to the touch.

TRAINCARDKEY.name: Card key

EXPALL.name: Exp Share
EXPALL.description: ON, upon gaining exp, it will share exp between your team members.

EXPALLOFF.name: Exp Share
EXPALLOFF.description: OFF, upon gaining exp, it will share exp between your team members.

SCROLLOFWATERS.description: A peculiar scroll that can make a certain Pokémon evolve. Written upon it are the true secrets of the path of water.

LEADERSCREST.name: Leader's Crest
LEADERSCREST.description: A shard of what appears to be an old blade of some sort. It is held only by Bisharp that head up a group of Pawniard.

BOOSTERENERGY.name: Booster Energy
BOOSTERENERGY.description: An item to be held by Pokémon with certain Abilities. It boosts the strength of the Pokémon.

ABILITYSHIELD.name: Ability Shield
ABILITYSHIELD.description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. This  shield protects the holder from having its Ability changed by others.

CLEARAMULET.name: Clear Amulet
CLEARAMULET.description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It protects the holder from having its stats lowered by moves or Pokémon's Abilities.

MIRRORHERB.name: Mirror Herb
MIRRORHERB.description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. This herb will allow the holder to mirror an opponent's stat increases-but only once.

PUNCHINGGLOVE.name: Punching Glove
PUNCHINGGLOVE.description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It boosts the holder's punching moves and prevents direct contact with targets.

COVERTCLOAK.name: Covert Cloak
COVERTCLOAK.description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It conceals the holder, protecting it from the additional effects of moves.

LOADEDDICE.name: Loaded Dice
LOADEDDICE.description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It ensures the holder's multistrike moves hit more times.

GIMMIGHOULCOIN.name: Gimmighoul Coin
GIMMIGHOULCOIN.description: An item that accidentally dropped by a Pokémon. It seems that Gimmighoul treasure and hoard these.

TERAORB.name: Tera Orb
TERAORB.description: An orb that holds the power to crystallize. When charged, it allows Pokémon to Terastallize.

NORMALTERASHARD.name: Normal Tera Shard
NORMALTERASHARD.description: On rare occasions, these shards form when a Tera Pokémon falls in battle and its Tera Jewel shatters.

MYSTERYTERAJEWEL.name: Mystery Tera Jewel
MYSTERYTERAJEWEL.description: A mostly in-tact Tera Jewel. Its awkward shape makes it hard to tell what Tera Type it may unlock.

MASTERTERAJEWEL.name: Master Tera Jewel
MASTERTERAJEWEL.description: A perfectly hexogonal Tera Jewel. Using this can unlock any Tera Type that the user desires.

RADIANTTERAJEWEL.name: Radiant Tera Jewel
RADIANTTERAJEWEL.description: A jewel glistening with Tera energy. It can fully recharge your Tera Orb in battle.

INFIREPEL.name: Infinite Repel
INFIREPEL.description: An item that prevents weak wild Pokémon from appearing. Can be toggled on and off

INFIREPELOFF.name: Infinite Repel (Off)
INFIREPELOFF.description: An item that prevents weak wild Pokémon from appearing. Can be toggled on and off

IVCHARM.name: Gene Charm
IVCHARM.description: A charm said to increase the change of finding Wild Pokémon with better genes.

HERITAGECHARM.name: Heritage Charm
HERITAGECHARM.description: A chiming charm said to increase the chance of finding Wild Pokémon with an Egg Move.

STEPCHARM.name: Step Charm
STEPCHARM.description: A warm charm said to decrease the amount of steps needed to hatch an egg.

FRIENDSHIPCHARM.name: Friendship Charm
FRIENDSHIPCHARM.description: A calming charm said to increase the friendship of Pokémon.

HEALINGCHARM.name: Healing Charm
HEALINGCHARM.description: A charm that doubles potion strength and restores HP while walking.

CLOVERCHARM.name: Clover Charm
CLOVERCHARM.description: A charm said to increase the probability of wild pokemon holding items.

GOLDCHARM.name: Gold Charm
GOLDCHARM.description: A charm said to increase gold gained from Trainer battles by 50%.

DATACABLE.name: Data Cable
DATACABLE.description: An odd looking cable cord. Doesn't look like it fits into any electronic I've seen.

MISTYDEW.name: Misty Dew
MISTYDEW.description: A foggy orb to be held by Morphias or Morphios. It boosts the holder's spatk and spdef by 1.5x during Misty Terrain, once per battle.

LIGHTFEATHER.name: Light Feather
LIGHTFEATHER.description: This warm feather reflects the sun's rays in its plumage, a certain Pokemon would love this item.

DARKFEATHER.name: Dark Feather
DARKFEATHER.description: This chilly feather reflects the night sky in its plumage, a certain Pokémon would love this item.

BERRYPOTS.name: Berry Pots
BERRYPOTS.description: Handy containers for cultivating Berries wherever you go.

SHATTEREDDISK.name: Shattered Disk
SHATTEREDDISK.description: This disk fills you with a feeling of uncertainty, it's likely not from this world. A certain Pokemon might react strongly to it..
